body: Is this reliably reproducible, and does it happen without the JSON runner?

Yes, seems reliable. One other difference is v.0.11.0 is via brew install and v.0.12.1 is via go get, could that make a difference?

Without JSON runner: 
```
$ time ~/go/bin/k6 run --iterations 50 --vus 20 http://109.228.153.2/style.css && time k6 run --iterations 50 --vus 20 http://109.228.153.2/style.css

          /\      |‾‾|  /‾‾/  /‾/   
     /\  /  \     |  |_/  /  / /   
    /  \/    \    |      |  /  ‾‾\  
   /          \   |  |‾\  \ | (_) | 
  / __________ \  |__|  \__\ \___/  Welcome to k6 v0.12.1!

  execution: local
     output: -
     script: http://109.228.153.2/style.css (url)

   duration: 0s, iterations: 50
        vus: 20, max: 20

    web ui: http://127.0.0.1:6565/

      done [==========================================================]    6m22.6s / 6m22.6s

    http_req_blocked......: avg=14.31ms, max=715.26ms, med=6.43µs, min=1.29µs, p90=64.91µs, p95=140.72µs
    http_req_connecting...: avg=14.28ms, max=714.99ms, med=0s, min=0s, p90=0s, p95=0s
    http_req_duration.....: avg=313.12ms, max=2.1s, med=207.06ms, min=194.05ms, p90=739.97ms, p95=1.06s
    http_req_looking_up...: avg=0s, max=0s, med=0s, min=0s, p90=0s, p95=0s
    http_req_receiving....: avg=127.52µs, max=24ms, med=73.1µs, min=17.67µs, p90=149.34µs, p95=197.17µs
    http_req_sending......: avg=62.93µs, max=2.11ms, med=38µs, min=8.47µs, p90=101.55µs, p95=146.76µs
    http_req_waiting......: avg=298.62ms, max=1.4s, med=206.91ms, min=193.96ms, p90=661.51ms, p95=957.85ms
    http_reqs.............: 1000
    iterations............: 1000
    vus...................: 20
    vus_max...............: 20

real	6m23.960s
user	0m17.893s
sys	0m23.198s

          /\      |‾‾|  /‾‾/  /‾/   
     /\  /  \     |  |_/  /  / /   
    /  \/    \    |   _  |  /  ‾‾\  
   /          \   |  | \  \ | (_) | 
  / __________ \  |__|  \__\ \___/  Welcome to k6 v0.11.0!

  execution: local
     output: -
     script: [cmdline] (url)

   duration: 0s, iterations: 50
        vus: 20, max: 20

    web ui: http://127.0.0.1:6565/

      done [==========================================================]      17.5s / 17.5s

    http_req_blocked......: avg=14.16ms, max=709.47ms, med=2.77µs, min=977ns, p90=4.91µs, p95=23.91µs
    http_req_connecting...: avg=14.15ms, max=708.97ms, med=0s, min=0s, p90=0s, p95=0s
    http_req_duration.....: avg=321.42ms, max=1.79s, med=206.47ms, min=196.21ms, p90=726.89ms, p95=1.04s
    http_req_looking_up...: avg=0s, max=0s, med=0s, min=0s, p90=0s, p95=0s
    http_req_receiving....: avg=103.13µs, max=10.39ms, med=76.25µs, min=15.97µs, p90=137.45µs, p95=173.03µs
    http_req_sending......: avg=41.85µs, max=4.91ms, med=29.26µs, min=9.49µs, p90=50.68µs, p95=76.03µs
    http_req_waiting......: avg=307.12ms, max=1.79s, med=206.3ms, min=196.08ms, p90=661.81ms, p95=730.11ms
    http_reqs.............: 1000
    iterations............: 1000
    vus...................: 20
    vus_max...............: 20

real	0m18.534s
user	0m1.876s
sys	0m1.364s
```
Confirmed difference in exec time also when running the v0.12.1 vs v0.11.0 containers from Docker Hub => problem does not seem related to installation.

Yeah I tried running the pre-built 11.0 binary for MacOS just now:

```
echo 'import http from "k6/http"; export default function() { http.get("http://109.228.153.2"); }' |./k6 run --duration 5s --vus 100 -

<snip>

http_req_blocked......: avg=158.2µs, max=49.35ms, med=1.77µs, min=816ns, p90=3.44µs, p95=12.52µs
    http_req_connecting...: avg=20.09µs, max=6.49ms, med=0s, min=0s, p90=0s, p95=0s
    http_req_duration.....: avg=21.08ms, max=272.2ms, med=15.03ms, min=3.01ms, p90=43.58ms, p95=55.26ms
    http_req_looking_up...: avg=0s, max=0s, med=0s, min=0s, p90=0s, p95=0s
    http_req_receiving....: avg=859.55µs, max=258.06ms, med=83.45µs, min=41.4µs, p90=699.31µs, p95=2.08ms
    http_req_sending......: avg=43.83µs, max=23.69ms, med=12.27µs, min=6.1µs, p90=33.2µs, p95=96.59µs
    http_req_waiting......: avg=20.02ms, max=265.68ms, med=14.78ms, min=2.91ms, p90=40.85ms, p95=51.86ms
    http_reqs.............: 22274
    iterations............: 22274
    vus...................: 100
    vus_max...............: 100
```

22,000 HTTP requests in 5 seconds. When I do the same with 12.1 I get this:

```
http_req_blocked......: avg=672.79µs, max=8.6ms, med=1.67µs, min=965ns, p90=5.07ms, p95=5.43ms
    http_req_connecting...: avg=627.16µs, max=6ms, med=0s, min=0s, p90=4.99ms, p95=5.31ms
    http_req_duration.....: avg=9.5ms, max=107.66ms, med=4.92ms, min=2.57ms, p90=16.34ms, p95=37.81ms
    http_req_looking_up...: avg=0s, max=0s, med=0s, min=0s, p90=0s, p95=0s
    http_req_receiving....: avg=600.58µs, max=73.86ms, med=79.99µs, min=46.16µs, p90=157.38µs, p95=2.86ms
    http_req_sending......: avg=20.41µs, max=962.57µs, med=12.39µs, min=6.99µs, p90=34.89µs, p95=52.49µs
    http_req_waiting......: avg=8.21ms, max=81.4ms, med=4.82ms, min=2.47ms, p90=13.72ms, p95=28.24ms
    http_reqs.............: 800
    iterations............: 800
    vus...................: 100
    vus_max...............: 100
```

800 requests instead of 22,000. Something is definitely slow here also.

issue.title: Added support for k6, fixes for a few update tools

repository.name: loadgentest
repository.description: Lab environment for benchmarking different load testing tools

body: If someone else could have a look at this, I'd really appreciate it, I won't be able to until I have a more permanent workspace sometime next week.

Given how little code was changed, finding the issue should not have been hard, but I really don't see how these changes could cause the drastically lowered performance. Perhaps there is a bug somewhere else, and these changes just exposes it more (increases its impact)?
That's… interesting, atomic increments shouldn't cause locking? But I'll have a look at this right now.

I CAN'T BELIEVE THAT WAS THE ENTIRE FIX

IT WAS TRIGGERING ERROR BACKOFFS FOR *SUCCESSFUL* ITERATIONS
